curam.util.cache
Interface CacheGroup

public interface CacheGroup

Manages a set of caches that share certain characteristics (replication strategy, disk store root path, default cache configuration...).

Method Summary

Method Detail

getCache

<K,V> Cache<K,V> getCache(java.lang.String cacheName)
This method looks up the cache with the given name. If a cache with name cacheName already exists then this cache will be returned, otherwise a new cache will be created using the default configuration. This newly created cache will be registered before being returned.
All caches defined in the cache group configuration are guaranteed to exist when this method is invoked.
The cache returned by this method should be cached whenever possible as the implementation of this method is likely to be guarded against concurrent access and as such it is not suitable for high frequency invocations.

Type Parameters:
K - the cache key
V - the cached value
Parameters:
cacheName - the name of the cache
Returns:
the cache with name cacheName

getCacheNames

java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getCacheNames()
Returns:
a set containing the names of all registered caches

getCaches

java.util.Collection<Cache> getCaches()
Returns:
all caches under this group

getName

java.lang.String getName()
Returns:
the name of this cache group

shutdown

void shutdown()
Cache groups require orderly shutdown. Invoke this method before the application shuts down.
